speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: SCENE IV. Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enter KING LEAR, Fool, and Gentleman

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: 'Tis strange that they should so depart from home,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And not send back my messenger.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: As I learn'd,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The night before there was no purpose in them

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Of this remove.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Hail to thee, noble master!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ha!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Makest thou this shame thy pastime?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: No, my lord.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Ha, ha! he wears cruel garters. Horses are tied

speaker: Fool
text_entry: by the heads, dogs and bears by the neck, monkeys by

speaker: Fool
text_entry: the loins, and men by the legs: when a man's

speaker: Fool
text_entry: over-lusty at legs, then he wears wooden

speaker: Fool
text_entry: nether-stocks.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What's he that hath so much thy place mistook

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To set thee here?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: It is both he and she;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Your son and daughter.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Yes.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, I say.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I say, yea.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, no, they would not.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Yes, they have.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: By Jupiter, I swear, no.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: By Juno, I swear, ay.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: They durst not do 't;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: They could not, would not do 't; 'tis worse than murder,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To do upon respect such violent outrage:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Resolve me, with all modest haste, which way

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou mightst deserve, or they impose, this usage,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Coming from us.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: My lord, when at their home

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I did commend your highness' letters to them,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Ere I was risen from the place that show'd

speaker: KENT
text_entry: My duty kneeling, came there a reeking post,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Stew'd in his haste, half breathless, panting forth

speaker: KENT
text_entry: From Goneril his mistress salutations;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Deliver'd letters, spite of intermission,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Which presently they read: on whose contents,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: They summon'd up their meiny, straight took horse;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Commanded me to follow, and attend

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The leisure of their answer; gave me cold looks:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And meeting here the other messenger,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Whose welcome, I perceived, had poison'd mine,--

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Being the very fellow that of late

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Display'd so saucily against your highness,--

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Having more man than wit about me, drew:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: He raised the house with loud and coward cries.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Your son and daughter found this trespass worth

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The shame which here it suffers.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Winter's not gone yet, if the wild-geese fly that way.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Fathers that wear rags

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Do make their children blind;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: But fathers that bear bags

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Shall see their children kind.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Fortune, that arrant whore,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Ne'er turns the key to the poor.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: But, for all this, thou shalt have as many dolours

speaker: Fool
text_entry: for thy daughters as thou canst tell in a year.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, how this mother swells up toward my heart!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hysterica passio, down, thou climbing sorrow,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thy element's below! Where is this daughter?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: With the earl, sir, here within.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Follow me not;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Stay here.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Made you no more offence but what you speak of?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: None.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: How chance the king comes with so small a train?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And thou hadst been set i' the stocks for that

speaker: Fool
text_entry: question, thou hadst well deserved it.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Why, fool?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: We'll set thee to school to an ant, to teach thee

speaker: Fool
text_entry: there's no labouring i' the winter. All that follow

speaker: Fool
text_entry: their noses are led by their eyes but blind men; and

speaker: Fool
text_entry: there's not a nose among twenty but can smell him

speaker: Fool
text_entry: that's stinking. Let go thy hold when a great wheel

speaker: Fool
text_entry: runs down a hill, lest it break thy neck with

speaker: Fool
text_entry: following it: but the great one that goes up the

speaker: Fool
text_entry: hill, let him draw thee after. When a wise man

speaker: Fool
text_entry: gives thee better counsel, give me mine again: I

speaker: Fool
text_entry: would have none but knaves follow it, since a fool gives it.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: That sir which serves and seeks for gain,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And follows but for form,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Will pack when it begins to rain,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And leave thee in the storm,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: But I will tarry; the fool will stay,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And let the wise man fly:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The knave turns fool that runs away;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The fool no knave, perdy.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Where learned you this, fool?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Not i' the stocks, fool.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Re-enter KING LEAR with GLOUCESTER

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Deny to speak with me? They are sick? they are weary?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: They have travell'd all the night? Mere fetches;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The images of revolt and flying off.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Fetch me a better answer.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My dear lord,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You know the fiery quality of the duke;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: How unremoveable and fix'd he is

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In his own course.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Vengeance! plague! death! confusion!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Fiery? what quality? Why, Gloucester, Gloucester,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I'ld speak with the Duke of Cornwall and his wife.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Well, my good lord, I have inform'd them so.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Inform'd them! Dost thou understand me, man?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ay, my good lord.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The king would speak with Cornwall; the dear father

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Would with his daughter speak, commands her service:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Are they inform'd of this? My breath and blood!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Fiery? the fiery duke? Tell the hot duke that--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, but not yet: may be he is not well:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Infirmity doth still neglect all office

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Whereto our health is bound; we are not ourselves

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When nature, being oppress'd, commands the mind

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To suffer with the body: I'll forbear;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And am fall'n out with my more headier will,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To take the indisposed and sickly fit

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: For the sound man. Death on my state! wherefore

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Looking on KENT

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Should he sit here? This act persuades me

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That this remotion of the duke and her

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Is practise only. Give me my servant forth.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Go tell the duke and 's wife I'ld speak with them,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Now, presently: bid them come forth and hear me,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Or at their chamber-door I'll beat the drum

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Till it cry sleep to death.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I would have all well betwixt you.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O me, my heart, my rising heart! but, down!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Cry to it, nuncle, as the cockney did to the eels

speaker: Fool
text_entry: when she put 'em i' the paste alive; she knapped 'em

speaker: Fool
text_entry: o' the coxcombs with a stick, and cried 'Down,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: wantons, down!' 'Twas her brother that, in pure

speaker: Fool
text_entry: kindness to his horse, buttered his hay.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Enter CORNWALL, REGAN, GLOUCESTER, and Servants

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Good morrow to you both.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Hail to your grace!

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: KENT is set at liberty

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I am glad to see your highness.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Regan, I think you are; I know what reason

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I have to think so: if thou shouldst not be glad,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I would divorce me from thy mother's tomb,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Sepulchring an adultress.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To KENT

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, are you free?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Some other time for that. Beloved Regan,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thy sister's naught: O Regan, she hath tied

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Sharp-tooth'd unkindness, like a vulture, here:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Points to his heart

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I can scarce speak to thee; thou'lt not believe

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: With how depraved a quality--O Regan!

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I pray you, sir, take patience: I have hope.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: You less know how to value her desert

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Than she to scant her duty.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Say, how is that?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I cannot think my sister in the least

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Would fail her obligation: if, sir, perchance

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: She have restrain'd the riots of your followers,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: 'Tis on such ground, and to such wholesome end,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: As clears her from all blame.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: My curses on her!

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: O, sir, you are old.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Nature in you stands on the very verge

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Of her confine: you should be ruled and led

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: By some discretion, that discerns your state

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Better than you yourself. Therefore, I pray you,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: That to our sister you do make return;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Say you have wrong'd her, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ask her forgiveness?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Do you but mark how this becomes the house:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: 'Dear daughter, I confess that I am old;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Kneeling

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Age is unnecessary: on my knees I beg

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That you'll vouchsafe me raiment, bed, and food.'

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Good sir, no more; these are unsightly tricks:

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Return you to my sister.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: [Rising]  Never, Regan:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: She hath abated me of half my train;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Look'd black upon me; struck me with her tongue,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Most serpent-like, upon the very heart:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: All the stored vengeances of heaven fall

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: On her ingrateful top! Strike her young bones,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You taking airs, with lameness!

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Fie, sir, fie!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You nimble lightnings, dart your blinding flames

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Into her scornful eyes! Infect her beauty,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You fen-suck'd fogs, drawn by the powerful sun,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To fall and blast her pride!

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: O the blest gods! so will you wish on me,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: When the rash mood is on.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, Regan, thou shalt never have my curse:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thy tender-hefted nature shall not give

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thee o'er to harshness: her eyes are fierce; but thine

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Do comfort and not burn. 'Tis not in thee

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To grudge my pleasures, to cut off my train,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To bandy hasty words, to scant my sizes,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And in conclusion to oppose the bolt

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Against my coming in: thou better know'st

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The offices of nature, bond of childhood,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Effects of courtesy, dues of gratitude;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thy half o' the kingdom hast thou not forgot,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Wherein I thee endow'd.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Good sir, to the purpose.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Who put my man i' the stocks?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Tucket within

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: What trumpet's that?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I know't, my sister's: this approves her letter,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: That she would soon be here.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Enter OSWALD

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Is your lady come?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: This is a slave, whose easy-borrow'd pride

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dwells in the fickle grace of her he follows.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Out, varlet, from my sight!

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: What means your grace?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Who stock'd my servant? Regan, I have good hope

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou didst not know on't. Who comes here? O heavens,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Enter GONERIL

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If you do love old men, if your sweet sway

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Allow obedience, if yourselves are old,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Make it your cause; send down, and take my part!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To GONERIL

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Art not ashamed to look upon this beard?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O Regan, wilt thou take her by the hand?

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Why not by the hand, sir? How have I offended?

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: All's not offence that indiscretion finds

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And dotage terms so.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O sides, you are too tough;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Will you yet hold? How came my man i' the stocks?

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: I set him there, sir: but his own disorders

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Deserved much less advancement.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You! did you?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I pray you, father, being weak, seem so.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: If, till the expiration of your month,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: You will return and sojourn with my sister,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Dismissing half your train, come then to me:

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I am now from home, and out of that provision

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Which shall be needful for your entertainment.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Return to her, and fifty men dismiss'd?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, rather I abjure all roofs, and choose

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To wage against the enmity o' the air;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To be a comrade with the wolf and owl,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Necessity's sharp pinch! Return with her?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, the hot-blooded France, that dowerless took

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Our youngest born, I could as well be brought

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To knee his throne, and, squire-like; pension beg

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To keep base life afoot. Return with her?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Persuade me rather to be slave and sumpter

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To this detested groom.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pointing at OSWALD

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: At your choice, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I prithee, daughter, do not make me mad:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will not trouble thee, my child; farewell:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: We'll no more meet, no more see one another:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But yet thou art my flesh, my blood, my daughter;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Or rather a disease that's in my flesh,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Which I must needs call mine: thou art a boil,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A plague-sore, an embossed carbuncle,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: In my corrupted blood. But I'll not chide thee;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let shame come when it will, I do not call it:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I do not bid the thunder-bearer shoot,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Nor tell tales of thee to high-judging Jove:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Mend when thou canst; be better at thy leisure:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I can be patient; I can stay with Regan,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I and my hundred knights.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Not altogether so:

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I look'd not for you yet, nor am provided

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: For your fit welcome. Give ear, sir, to my sister;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: For those that mingle reason with your passion

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Must be content to think you old, and so--

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: But she knows what she does.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Is this well spoken?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I dare avouch it, sir: what, fifty followers?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Is it not well? What should you need of more?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Yea, or so many, sith that both charge and danger

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Speak 'gainst so great a number? How, in one house,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Should many people, under two commands,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Hold amity? 'Tis hard; almost impossible.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Why might not you, my lord, receive attendance

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: From those that she calls servants or from mine?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Why not, my lord? If then they chanced to slack you,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: We could control them. If you will come to me,--

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: For now I spy a danger,--I entreat you

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: To bring but five and twenty: to no more

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Will I give place or notice.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I gave you all--

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And in good time you gave it.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Made you my guardians, my depositaries;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But kept a reservation to be follow'd

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: With such a number. What, must I come to you

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: With five and twenty, Regan? said you so?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And speak't again, my lord; no more with me.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Those wicked creatures yet do look well-favour'd,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When others are more wicked: not being the worst

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Stands in some rank of praise.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To GONERIL

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I'll go with thee:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thy fifty yet doth double five and twenty,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And thou art twice her love.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Hear me, my lord;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: What need you five and twenty, ten, or five,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: To follow in a house where twice so many

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Have a command to tend you?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: What need one?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, reason not the need: our basest beggars

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Are in the poorest thing superfluous:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Allow not nature more than nature needs,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Man's life's as cheap as beast's: thou art a lady;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If only to go warm were gorgeous,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, nature needs not what thou gorgeous wear'st,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Which scarcely keeps thee warm. But, for true need,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You heavens, give me that patience, patience I need!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You see me here, you gods, a poor old man,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: As full of grief as age; wretched in both!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If it be you that stir these daughters' hearts

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Against their father, fool me not so much

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To bear it tamely; touch me with noble anger,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And let not women's weapons, water-drops,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Stain my man's cheeks! No, you unnatural hags,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will have such revenges on you both,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That all the world shall--I will do such things,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What they are, yet I know not: but they shall be

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The terrors of the earth. You think I'll weep

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, I'll not weep:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I have full cause of weeping; but this heart

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Shall break into a hundred thousand flaws,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Or ere I'll weep. O fool, I shall go mad!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exeunt KING LEAR, GLOUCESTER, KENT, and Fool

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Storm and tempest

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Let us withdraw; 'twill be a storm.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: This house is little: the old man and his people

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Cannot be well bestow'd.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: 'Tis his own blame; hath put himself from rest,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And must needs taste his folly.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: For his particular, I'll receive him gladly,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: But not one follower.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: So am I purposed.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Where is my lord of Gloucester?

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Follow'd the old man forth: he is return'd.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Re-enter GLOUCESTER

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The king is in high rage.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Whither is he going?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He calls to horse; but will I know not whither.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: 'Tis best to give him way; he leads himself.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: My lord, entreat him by no means to stay.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Alack, the night comes on, and the bleak winds

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Do sorely ruffle; for many miles a bout

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: There's scarce a bush.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: O, sir, to wilful men,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: The injuries that they themselves procure

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Must be their schoolmasters. Shut up your doors:

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: He is attended with a desperate train;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And what they may incense him to, being apt

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: To have his ear abused, wisdom bids fear.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Shut up your doors, my lord; 'tis a wild night:

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: My Regan counsels well; come out o' the storm.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Exeunt
